snippet: A bill to increase female representation in Parliament is on hold, again.
abstract: A bill to increase female representation in Parliament is on hold, again.
lead_paragraph: The Indian Parliament will "remain a male bastion for the near future," Nilanjana S. Roy writes in the International Herald Tribune. The lower house, "almost 90 percent male in its composition, had ensured that a bill intended to increase the number of female members would not be passed for at least another year," she writes.

headline.main: A Long Wait for Equality in Parliament
